page.title: 01INTRODUCTION TO NORTHWOLD
page.content: Northwold is a small conservation village set amidst arable farming land in the county of Norfolk.It is a linear village a quarter of a mile east of the main A134 Kings Lynn to Thetford road. The population of Northwold is about 800.The life of most villagers is centered around the home for general recreation and entertainment. There are many clubs for both adults and children. Most employment is outside the village.The church and religion play a small part.There are three shops,a Trading Company and several small, sundry businesses.The parish council is responsible for some public administration.A policeman drives around the area to enforce law and order.Public transport is provided by bus and private coach.The village has many annual events.
